artist: Assistant: Attributed to Ivan Vasilievich Kliun
creditline: The John R. Van Derlip Fund
description: cubist style; face of man with clock in LLC and partial clock faces in ULC and URC; zigzag shapes in lower corners; tans, greys; received unframed
provenance:
Moisei Zaks, United States (by 1956–1991) [1]; his nephew, Leonid Zaks and Elena Zaks, Ramat Gan, Israel (1991–2007; consigned to Robert Hiedemann Fine Art, Richmond, Virginia, sold to Mia)

[1] Zaks reportedly acquired the painting in ine Soviet Union and granted permission to export his paintings collection in Moscow in December 1956 to January 1957 when he traveled to Belarus
signed: LRC, in red: signature in Russian
title: The Clockmaker (Der Uhrmacher/ L'horloger)
